channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @ShulimLeifer What business would you recommend for making friends?
@lrozen Sort of the flip side of Bibi so scaring Obama about the threat that he reached for the deal.
This. https://t.co/x1JIxbPV3i
And yet, misogynist religions still get tax breaks. Maybe that should change. https://t.co/erumMdQiQc
@joshtpm When you believe in heaven, you don‚Äôt need to deal with policy; you can count on God to give Anne Frank and Adolph Eichmann their aporopriate just desserts. https://t.co/iSvKYCgDk4
@TheRaDR Did you see this post from earlier this month from the manufacturer of the murder weapon? https://t.co/uucbZe9oAw
Two words. Backpack nukes. https://t.co/xmJ8nvkMAR
@Will_Bunch @froomkin Two words: Hindenburg Democrats. More scared of their shadows then of the fascists they‚Äôre preparing to hand the keys to.

@shaifranklin Gotta admire Joe‚Äôs choosing the political win over Israel‚Äôs strategic interests.
@shaifranklin Anyway, one of the biggest pro Israel hawks in DC has doubts about how serious the Jews really take any of this, so ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è https://t.co/soZ6nUPq7v
@frumfollies @JasonSCampbell Ultimately, Congress pays for the security guards.
@HeldShai @datadivajf When we stopped fighting about religion in the name of civility, religion lost all ability for self-critique.

@helenprejean @datadivajf As a nun, I ask you to deal with this advertisements from the manufacturer of the murder weapon. I‚Äôm not an expert in rye lines between blasphemy and sacrilege and heresy from a Catholic perspective, but it certainly seems what we Jews call treif. Time for some high level shaming https://t.co/HUj4OYn69P
@cstross Backpack nukes.

@Atrios Some clever suggestions for unilateral action in this thread; https://t.co/v25uOx6ayD
@Atrios But of course, such action risks offending the imaginary swing voters who the Hindenburg Democrats have granted the keys of the country to.

Your occasional reminder that Israel is not investing enough in time travel technology. If our past is important ‚Äî and it is ‚Äî it‚Äôs worth bending the laws of physics to see it in person. https://t.co/ARHVyS7zmo
And if a couple Hasmonean butterflies get trampled along the way ‚Äî really, how much worse could it get?
This. https://t.co/0jyozSWJcS

@avitalrachel Did you see this teeet from earlier this month from the gun‚Äôs manufacturer? https://t.co/zNrEb7iLMS
@avitalrachel Also: AIPAC has endorsed that congressman and donated to him. So it might be a cult, and it might be blasphemy, but he can walk around with rabbinic endorsement.
@JasonSCampbell Schumer should push through a bill permitting open carry in the Supreme Court gallery.
@hilzoy See, the Catholics had centuries to figure it out. Evangelicals operate in an unregulated theological free-for-all.

@hilzoy Note that this is a biblical quote, and certainly heretical from a Catholic perspective, but they can put it out there with no fear of pushback.
@hilzoy But from a theological perspective, if he dies as a child he goes to heaven, but if he grows up and accesses forbidden literature, he might go to hell. So the incentives for Evangelicals really are different.
@owillis If his colleagues won‚Äôt call him out, and the Democrats won‚Äôt call out the Republicans for not calling him out, why should he act better?

@LeelaCorman @RokhlK See, working in publishing gives me perspective. I can‚Äôt wait for the profits that will be raked in by the authors of survivor memoirs in the wake of the Second Civil War. And the heartwarming historical novels!
